title: This WEBSITE was made with R!?
text:
What is Quarto
Quarto is an additional program designed to compliment R. It uses R’s markdown feature, which allows you to create documents, such as journal articles, while integrating charts/graphs directly from R. Quarto takes this a step further and allows you to write books, websites, and other documents using R. This means that scholars who are familiar with the R language can create their own custom websites.


This Site
This files for this site are available on my Github for all to see. When you view the .qmd files, you can see exactly what I have to type in order to program this website. In future posts, I hope to create easy to follow tutorials, so that I can help academics make personal websites and blogs just like this one!

title: Machine Learning in Psychology
text: Machine Learning is an emerging method in not only Computer Science but also in the Psychological Sciences. Allowing artificial intelligence to parse over data and then make predictions after training will advance the field in more ways than imaginable.

title: Machine Learning in Psychology
text:
Veterans and Suicidality
I want to draw from one article discussing how Veterans Administration researchers used Machine Learning (ML) to save lives. In this article, researchers used over 61 variables and an actual data set of veterans to predict which veterans would be a potential high-suicide risk reliably. This model was tested at a VA Healthcare System.

title: Machine Learning in Psychology
text:
Machine Learning Beats Clinicians
This model predicted veterans who were 30~60 times more likely to engage in suicidal behaviors than others in a sample. Within this sample, clinicians could only identify 30% of veterans that the ML model predicted would be a risk. ML can miss the often hidden warning signs of suicide because it knows where to look.

title: Machine Learning in Psychology
text:
Citation
Reger, G. M., McClure, M. L., Ruskin, D., Carter, S. P., & Reger, M. A. (2019). Integrating predictive modeling into mental health care: An example in suicide prevention. Psychiatric Services, 70(1), 71–74. https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.ps.201800242

title: J.D. Dato
text:
J.D. Dato is an undergraduate psychology student interested in Software Development and Clinical Psychology.
I currently work as a research assistant at USF’s Addiction Research and Treatment Lab.

title: J.D. Dato
text:
Education
University of South Florida| B.A. Psychology
Aug 2021 - Present

title: J.D. Dato
text:
Technical Skills

R : I am comfortable using R to transform, visualize, and model data. I’ve also used R for non-data purposes, such as developing this website with R markdown.
Python : I use Python for some data tasks but primarily for automation and writing other scripts. When necessary, I can use the everyday data science libraries that are made for the Python language.
Linux: I operate my Home Lab server, which has given me the basic knowledge of maintaining and setting up Linux servers using the command line. This includes implementing security measures to prevent data from being compromised and protecting against other common cyber-attacks.

title: J.D. Dato
text:
What I am currently learning:

Rayshader

Rayshader is a library for R that allows the creation of 3D Data-Visualizaitons. These kinds of visualizations are important because they are the most eye-catching, in my opinion.

Flask

Flask is a Python library that allows the creation of web applications. I am currently using Flask to create a web application that allows players in a clay shooting tournament to see their scores in real-time.
